Operation 'post-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/recordings/ready_markAsReady' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description lacks clarity on input requirements (what goes in request body), output details (what is returned), and side effects (transcription processing begins). Added specifics about request body structure, return value, and the effect of marking as ready to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_summary: Mark recording as ready for transcription
data.current_description: Mark a call recording as ready for transcription, specifying the call by its ID (`engagementid`).
data.description_suggestion: Mark a call recording as ready for transcription processing. Requires the engagement ID of the call recording to be marked. The request body must include the engagement ID. Upon success, the recording status is updated to ready and transcription processing will begin. Returns confirmation of the status change.
data.reasoning: Current description lacks clarity on input requirements (what goes in request body), output details (what is returned), and side effects (transcription processing begins). Added specifics about request body structure, return value, and the effect of marking as ready to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'get-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings/channel-connection_getById' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Original description relies heavily on external documentation link and lacks specificity about what settings are returned. Added clarity on required parameter (appId), what the operation retrieves, and what the response contains to help AI agents understand the operation's scope and output.

data.current_description: Retrieve the settings related to the app's [channel connection](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/extensions/third-party-calling#fetch-existing-channel-connection-settings).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the channel connection settings configured for the specified app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter. Returns the complete channel connection settings object including connection configuration and webhook details for the app.
data.reasoning: Original description relies heavily on external documentation link and lacks specificity about what settings are returned. Added clarity on required parameter (appId), what the operation retrieves, and what the response contains to help AI agents understand the operation's scope and output.

message: Operation 'post-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings/channel-connection_create' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description is too brief and relies on external documentation. Added details about required parameters (appId), request body expectations, return value, and the operational effect (establishes connection) to provide AI agents with clear guidance on when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: Configure [channel connection settings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/extensions/third-party-calling#create-channel-connection-settings) for the app.
data.description_suggestion: Create and configure channel connection settings for the specified app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter and channel connection configuration in the request body. Returns the created channel connection settings object with all configured properties. This operation establishes the connection between the app and the calling channel.
data.reasoning: Original description is too brief and relies on external documentation. Added details about required parameters (appId), request body expectations, return value, and the operational effect (establishes connection) to provide AI agents with clear guidance on when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'delete-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings/channel-connection_archive' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary uses 'Delete' which is vague for API operations; 'Remove' is more precise. Description lacks context about what happens after deletion (connection disabled), return value, and irreversibility. Added these details to help AI agents understand the consequences of this destructive operation and when it should be used.

data.current_description: Delete the [channel connection settings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/extensions/third-party-calling#delete-existing-channel-connection-settings) for the app.
data.summary_suggestion: Remove channel connection settings for the app
data.description_suggestion: Remove the channel connection settings for the specified app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter. Upon successful deletion, the app's channel connection is disabled and the calling extension will no longer be able to use this connection. Returns a success confirmation. This operation cannot be undone without reconfiguring the settings.
data.reasoning: Summary uses 'Delete' which is vague for API operations; 'Remove' is more precise. Description lacks context about what happens after deletion (connection disabled), return value, and irreversibility. Added these details to help AI agents understand the consequences of this destructive operation and when it should be used.

data.current_description: Update existing [channel connection settings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/extensions/third-party-calling#manage-the-webhook-settings-for-channel-connection) for your app.
data.description_suggestion: Update existing channel connection settings for the specified app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter and the fields to update in the request body. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified while existing settings remain unchanged. Returns the updated channel connection settings object reflecting all changes.
data.reasoning: Original description is vague and relies on external documentation. Added clarity on required parameters (appId), request body expectations, partial update behavior (important for PATCH operations), and return value. This helps AI agents understand that they can update specific fields without affecting others.

data.current_description: Retrieve the settings configured for the app.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve calling extension settings for app
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the calling extension settings configured for the specified app, including menu label, target iframe URL, dimensions, and other configuration details. Returns a SettingsResponse object containing all current settings.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about what settings are returned and doesn't mention the response schema. Enhanced version clarifies the domain context (calling extension), specifies what settings are included, and explicitly mentions the return type for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'delete-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings_archive' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate, but description lacks important context about permanence and irreversibility. Added clarification that this is a permanent deletion and cannot be undone, which is critical information for AI agents to avoid accidental destructive operations. Also clarified the required parameter.

data.current_description: Delete a calling extension. This will remove your service as an option for all connected accounts.
data.description_suggestion: Delete a calling extension and its associated settings. This operation permanently removes the calling extension and makes your service unavailable as an option for all connected accounts. This action cannot be undone. Requires the appId parameter.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks important context about permanence and irreversibility. Added clarification that this is a permanent deletion and cannot be undone, which is critical information for AI agents to avoid accidental destructive operations. Also clarified the required parameter.

message: Operation 'patch-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings_update' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about what can be updated, whether updates are partial or full, and what is returned. Enhanced version clarifies partial update behavior, mentions the request/response schemas, and specifies that only provided fields are modified, which is important for AI agents to understand the operation's behavior.

data.current_description: Update existing calling extension settings.
data.description_suggestion: Update existing calling extension settings using partial updates. Accepts a SettingsPatchRequest containing the fields to be modified (menu label, iframe URL, dimensions, etc.). Only provided fields will be updated; omitted fields remain unchanged. Returns the updated SettingsResponse object.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. Description lacks specificity about what can be updated, whether updates are partial or full, and what is returned. Enhanced version clarifies partial update behavior, mentions the request/response schemas, and specifies that only provided fields are modified, which is important for AI agents to understand the operation's behavior.

data.current_description: Retrieve the URL that is registered for [call recording](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/apps/extensions/calling-extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#register-your-app-s-endpoint-with-hubspot-using-the-calling-settings-api).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve the external URL endpoint that is currently registered for call recording. This URL is used by HubSpot to retrieve call recordings from your service. Returns a RecordingSettingsResponse object containing the registered recording URL.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague and doesn't specify it's about the recording URL. Description relies on external documentation link and doesn't explain what is returned. Enhanced version clarifies that this retrieves the registered URL endpoint, explains its purpose, and explicitly mentions the response schema for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'post-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings/recording_registerUrlFormat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description relies on external documentation and lacks specificity about inputs and outputs. Enhanced version clarifies what the request body should contain, explains the operational flow (HubSpot will call this endpoint), and explicitly mentions the response schema for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Enable the app for call recording
data.current_description: Register an external URL that HubSpot will use to retrieve [call recordings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/apps/extensions/calling-extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#register-your-app-s-endpoint-with-hubspot-using-the-calling-settings-api).
data.description_suggestion: Register an external URL endpoint that HubSpot will use to retrieve call recordings from your service. Accepts a RecordingSettingsRequest containing the recording URL. Once registered, HubSpot will call this endpoint to fetch recordings. Returns a RecordingSettingsResponse confirming the registered URL.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description relies on external documentation and lacks specificity about inputs and outputs. Enhanced version clarifies what the request body should contain, explains the operational flow (HubSpot will call this endpoint), and explicitly mentions the response schema for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'patch-/crm/v3/extensions/calling/{appId}/settings/recording_updateUrlFormat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is vague and doesn't specify it's about the recording URL. Description relies on external documentation and lacks input/output details. Enhanced version clarifies that this updates the recording URL endpoint, specifies the request/response schemas, and explains that the change applies to future requests, which helps AI agents understand the operation's scope and effects.

data.current_description: Update the URL that HubSpot will use to retrieve [call recordings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/apps/extensions/calling-extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions#register-your-app-s-endpoint-with-hubspot-using-the-calling-settings-api).
data.description_suggestion: Update the external URL endpoint that HubSpot uses to retrieve call recordings. Accepts a RecordingSettingsPatchRequest containing the new recording URL. The updated URL will be used for all subsequent recording retrieval requests. Returns a RecordingSettingsResponse confirming the updated URL.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague and doesn't specify it's about the recording URL. Description relies on external documentation and lacks input/output details. data.current_summary: Mark recording as ready for transcription
data.current_description: Mark a call recording as ready for transcription, specifying the call by its ID (`engagementid`).

data.current_description: Delete the [channel connection settings](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/extensions/third-party-calling#delete-existing-channel-connection-settings) for the app.
data.summary_suggestion: Remove channel connection settings for the app
data.description_suggestion: Remove the channel connection settings for the specified app. Requires the app ID as a path parameter. Upon successful deletion, the app's channel connection is disabled and the calling extension will no longer be able to use this connection. Returns a success confirmation. This operation cannot be undone without reconfiguring the settings.
data.reasoning: Summary uses 'Delete' which is vague for API operations; 'Remove' is more precise. Description lacks context about what happens after deletion (connection disabled), return value, and irreversibility.
